title: Infrastructure Development
description: A program to improve roads, bridges, and public transportation systems across the country.
impact: Improved public infrastructure, reduced traffic congestion by 25%.

otherProjects.title: Economic Development Program
otherProjects.impact: Boosted GDP by 6%, created 100,000 jobs in the tech sector.

otherProjects.title: Healthcare Access Improvement
otherProjects.impact: Reduced child mortality by 30%, improved healthcare facilities.

otherProjects.title: Energy Infrastructure Expansion
otherProjects.impact: Increased access to electricity in rural areas by 40%.

title: Education Reform
description: An initiative to enhance access to quality education, increase teacher salaries, and improve school infrastructure.
impact: Increased student enrollment by 20%, improved school facilities.

otherProjects.title: Ethiopia's Green Legacy Initiative
otherProjects.impact: Created over 767,000 jobs in various sectors for mostly youths and women

otherProjects.title: Rural Development and Agricultural Support Program
otherProjects.impact: Improved rural infrastructure, enhanced agricultural productivity, and supported rural access to essential services.

otherProjects.title: Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam (GERD)
otherProjects.impact: Set to significantly boost Ethiopia's energy capacity, providing renewable energy and supporting nationwide electrification.

title: Global Trade Policy Reform
description: A global initiative aimed at reforming trade policies to ensure equitable access to markets and promote sustainable development in developing countries.
impact: Increased trade access for developing countries, reducing tariffs by 20% on key exports.

otherProjects.title: Support for Nigeria During the COVID-19 Pandemic
otherProjects.impact: Played a pivotal role in mobilizing international support for Nigeria, securing funding for health systems and ensuring access to healthcare during the pandemic.

otherProjects.title: Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) Advocacy
otherProjects.impact: Facilitated the achievement of 5 SDGs in over 40 countries.

otherProjects.title: African Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA)
otherProjects.impact: Led efforts to create a unified continental market, boosting intra-African trade by 15%.

title: National Infrastructure Development Plan
description: A large-scale initiative to modernize South Africa’s infrastructure, focusing on transportation, energy, and digital connectivity.
impact: Improved infrastructure connectivity, with a 30% increase in transportation capacity and 50% growth in renewable energy sources.

otherProjects.title: Land Reform Initiative
otherProjects.impact: Redistributed land to 200,000 families, with a focus on agriculture and sustainable development.

otherProjects.title: Youth Empowerment and Job Creation
otherProjects.impact: Created 100,000 new jobs for youth in South Africa, focusing on the tech, agriculture, and manufacturing sectors.

title: SDG Advocacy and Economic Development Initiatives for Africa
description: Amina Mohammed, as Deputy Secretary-General of the UN, has spearheaded multiple initiatives to drive sustainable development across Africa, particularly focusing on economic empowerment, youth inclusion, and climate resilience.
impact: Amina's efforts have led to advancements in youth empowerment, climate resilience, and sustainable economic development, promoting the African Continental Free Trade Agreement and calling for a $500 billion annual SDG stimulus. Her work has aimed to lift millions from poverty and foster sustainable industrialization across African nations.

relatedLinks.title: UN SDG Financing and Youth Inclusion Initiatives
Amina Mohammed on Africa's Economic Future

otherProjects.title: Youth Empowerment for Digital and Green Economies
otherProjects.impact: Launched partnerships to enhance skills training for African youth, aligning them with opportunities in green energy and digital sectors.

otherProjects.title: Climate Action through the Great Green Wall Initiative
otherProjects.impact: Supports the Great Green Wall to restore ecosystems, promote sustainable livelihoods, and reduce migration pressures across the Sahel.

otherProjects.title: SDG Financing Initiative for Africa
otherProjects.impact: Advocates for bridging the $10 billion annual funding gap needed in Nigeria to meet SDGs, engaging private sector investment for social impact projects.

title: Major Reforms and Infrastructure Development in Nigeria
description: Buhari’s administration implemented key reforms across infrastructure, oil and gas, social welfare, and agricultural sectors to modernize and stabilize Nigeria’s economy.
impact: Significantly increased national infrastructure and economic resilience, focusing on transportation, energy, and agricultural productivity. Over 3 million MSMEs benefited, contributing to youth and women empowerment.

relatedLinks.title: List of Buhari's Achievements in Nigeria

otherProjects.title: National Social Investment Program (NSIP)
otherProjects.impact: Established NSIP, Africa's largest social welfare program, benefiting over 30 million Nigerians through cash transfers, job creation, and entrepreneurship support.

otherProjects.title: Agricultural Reforms - Anchor Borrowers Program
otherProjects.impact: Boosted food production by financing 3.1 million smallholder farmers, expanding local production of key crops like rice and maize, with 3.8 million hectares cultivated.

otherProjects.title: Railway Modernization Project
otherProjects.impact: Modernized rail transport with projects like the Lagos-Ibadan and Abuja-Kaduna rail lines, reducing travel time and improving economic connectivity.

otherProjects.title: Petroleum Industry Act (PIA) Reform
otherProjects.impact: Passed the PIA after decades of delays, restructuring Nigeria's oil sector for increased investment and transparency.

otherProjects.title: COVID-19 Support Initiatives
otherProjects.impact: Provided economic support to households and businesses with a 300 billion Naira credit facility and the Survival Fund, aiding over 800,000 individuals and MSMEs.
